lead_paragraph: One year after Hurricane Katrina displaced the New Orleans Saints for the entire season, they have sold out the entire regular-season home schedule at the Louisiana Superdome. It is the first time in the history of the franchise, founded in 1967, that every available seat is owned by a season-ticket holder. The Saints return to the Superdome on Monday night against Atlanta.
